title: Topics in Ancient History
description: An investigation of selected themes, topics, time periods, and methods in ancient history.  This course is repeatable provided that the topic is different.  Examples could include:  Slavery and Cultural Exhange in Greco-Roman Antiquity; Asia Minor in the Hellenistic and Roman Periods; or The Ruler Cult in the Greco-Roman World.

title: Studies in Greek Literature
description: An investigation of selected themes, topics, time periods or genres in ancient Greek literature.  This course is repeatable provided that the topic is different.  One example could be Attic Drama and Civic Identity.
